definition: painstakingly/with great trouble
surname Xin

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
surname Xin

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly

sentences.english: Her mother laborious sews the cotton fabric.
sentences.chinese: 她的母亲辛辛苦苦的缝制棉织品。

sentences.english: We are not supposed to play ducks and drakes with the hard-earned money of our parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应随意滥用父母辛辛苦苦挣来的钱。

sentences.english: He earned only 3 silver dollar after pulling the rickshaw for a month.
sentences.chinese: 他辛辛苦苦拉一个月黄包车才赚3块现大洋。

sentences.english: I have beeb working hard all morning.
sentences.chinese: 我辛辛苦苦地干了整整一个上午。

sentences.english: We drudged away a whole day.
sentences.chinese: 我们辛辛苦苦干了一整天。

sentences.english: You live your life, work hard, and do the best you can.
sentences.chinese: 你有自己的生活，你辛辛苦苦工作，而且竭尽全力。

sentences.english: I have been working hard all morning.
sentences.chinese: 我辛辛苦苦的干了一上午活。

sentences.english: Why should you stop people doing what they want with their hard-earned cash?
sentences.chinese: 别人辛辛苦苦赚来的钱要怎么花关你什么事？

sentences.english: He fagged away at this work for weeks .
sentences.chinese: 这项工作他辛辛苦苦地干了好几个星期。

sentences.english: Those people that are toiling and moiling will get no more than peanuts .
sentences.chinese: 那些辛辛苦苦累死累活的人挣不到几个子儿。

sentences.english: Who wants to toil for years in order to reach a potentially better someday?
sentences.chinese: 谁愿意辛辛苦苦几年只为了过上未知的好日子。

sentences.english: I've fagged at this work all day.
sentences.chinese: 这活我已经辛辛苦苦地干了整整一天。

sentences.english: 'That is my hard-earned money, how can the developer be so ruthless?'
sentences.chinese: 这是我辛辛苦苦挣来的钱，开发商怎能这么无情呢？

sentences.english: He had been eking out a wretched existence, story-telling, or selling tobacco.
sentences.chinese: 他辛辛苦苦地凑合着生活，说书，或者卖烟草。

definition: one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
with great difficulty/very difficult
hard-earned money
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
in the end/finally/as a result
heart's blood/expenditure (for some project)/meticulous care
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to collect/to hoard/to accumulate/to save
to bring together
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to live frugally/to economize on food and clothing/to scrimp and save
see 掙扎|挣扎[zheng1 zha2]
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
